content.content: Hello @Alefcripto, Thank you for your questions.     Alefcripto:  Advantages opportunities with TrueUSD What’s new?   In terms of advantages, TrueUSD is the first digital asset with live on-chain attestations by independent third-party institutions and is backed 1:1 with the U.S. dollar. So far, it has been listed on more than 100 trading platforms such as Binance and Huobi, and is live on ten mainstream public chains including Ethereum, TRON, Avalanche, BSC, Fantom, and Polygon, with its total supply surging past 1.4 billion. In 2021, TrueUSD has had quite a few milestones that you can read about in our 2021 recap. More recently we have done listings on head DeFi projects with decent APRs, such as SpookySwap for example. We have also worked on a fast deployment on L1/L2 blockchains so out TrueUSD holders get a chance to join a new potential ecosystem in an early stage.     Alefcripto:  What backs up the TrueUSD token   TrueUSD is the first digital asset with live on-chain attestations by independent third-party institutions and is backed 1:1 with the U.S. dollar. So far, it has been listed on more than 100 trading platforms such as Binance and Huobi, and is live on ten mainstream public chains including Ethereum, TRON, Avalanche, BSC, Fantom, and Polygon, with its total supply surging past 1.4 billion. TrueUSD is attested to in real-time by Armanino, one of the largest U.S.-based accounting firms, to ensure the 1:1 ratio of its USD reserve to the circulating token supply and the 100% collateral rate. Users can access the publicly available audit results via the official website trueusd.com at any time.

content.content: AnnabelTUSD:  TrueUSD is the first digital asset with live on-chain attestations by independent third-party institutions and is backed 1:1 with the U.S. dollar.   Yes, but what assets are those backings? It is a mixture of fiat and debt (in United States and Hong Kong). Many stable tokens use United States treasury debt only. What debt does tusd use? There are other good debts besides United States treasury debt, but there are also many low quality debts in the world. Would be helpful to know what besides fiat is providing 1:1 backing, Thank you

content.content: From how I understand your question, this should clarify how each TUSD token is backed. The USD balance held in accounts are the total balances in accounts held by Techteryx at federally insured U.S. depository institutions and a Hong Kong depository institution for the benefit of the TUSD token holders as agreed to within the agreements. The USD balance held by U.S. depository institutions and Hong Kong depository institutions includes USD cash and cash equivalents that include short-erm, highly liquid investments of sufficient credit quality that are readily convertible to known amount of cash. Cash equivalents are recorded at cost which approximates the fair value, or cash value. In all cases, cash equivalents and other instruments are recorded at cost which approximates the fair value, or cash value. (Source: Downloaded Report TrustExplorer by Armanino: Real-Time Attest for TrueCurrency)
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Excellent if this is what I meant, good news for people who use TrueUSD. Hopefully they will expand to more chains.

I feel like for TUSD, the shift in sentiment really came after it was acquired by Techteryx which is associated with TRON. As TUSD Blog itself claimed: "Ownership of TUSD will be moving over to an Asia-based consortium that will be working with TRON " Now it might seem confusing to the current TUSD team why that matters. But the truth is that Tron’s reputation in the ETH ecosystem especially in the MakerDAO ecosystem is quite low. And this perception worsened recently as the team engaged in potential governance attacks.    coindesk.com – 4 Feb 22    Tron’s Justin Sun Accused of ‘Governance Attack’ on DeFi Lender Compound Crypto think tank GFX Labs says a prominent whale may be attempting to swing a vote in his favor.      There’s no doubt that TUSD is a significant stablecoin, but then the reputation is also important and I afraid that this will take a long time to build up such reputation at least within the Maker community.

content.content: Hi Doo, Thank you for your feedback. I am aware that since the transition there was a change in sentiment from the MakerDAO community towards TrueUSD. As you will be able to see on the forum, we have since then provided answers and proof of our transparency and security as a tokanof our good will to work with the users. As you have mentioned, yourself TUSD is a significant stablecoin, and its consistent growth and growing list of partners over the last year have to stand for proof of its quality. I believe we can all agree that if there was any doubt in TrueUSD since its acquisition by Techteryx, the growth would have been cut short. In regards to the alledged “governance attacks”, I’d like to state that this article was contested by the Compound community as soon as it was published. You will be able to check it online, Justin Sun had the greenlight from the compound team to borrow COMP in order to vote. Additionally, TUSD was  reviewed and confirmed as a low-risk associated collateral. Nevertheless, as previously stated if you’d like to contribute to this discussion by sharing your thoughts on TrueUSD as a stablecoin, by all means please do, feel free to contribute more to this thread!

content.content: What I had in mind for TrueUSD working with MakerDAO is to incorporate those real-time attestations into the vault or PSM creation process. This would provide a failsafe when minting DAI from the TUSD vault/PSM and reduce counterparty risk to TrueUSD. It’s great that you provide those attestations, but it would be better to automatically leverage them without the need to check manually. For example, using the Chainlink TUSD Proof-of-Reserve Feed that your team previously shared, the protocol can verify that TUSD is sufficiently backed before accepting TUSD into the vault/PSM and minting DAI. In the worst-case scenario, MakerDAO is protected from TUSD being illiquid and accepting more TUSD. On the flip side, this mechanism could also be used to flag any undercollateralized TUSD vaults that need to be liquidated. Theoretically, this should all be possible, but the TrueUSD team would need to work with MakerDAO to confirm if this is feasible. You’d then need to develop it for the vaults or PSM and outline the technical specifications, costs, risks, etc. Although TUSD is currently being offboarded, a continued commitment to transparency and security through blockchain-based solutions would make TrueUSD more trustworthy to me and hopefully others for any future vault or PSM proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal

content.content: Hi Annabel, I believe I can articulate the concern that the community has with your product. All centralized stablecoins including TUSD contain a freeze function that allows the issuer to freeze users assets. Other centralized stablecoins are controlled by entities that are either trustworthy or have a track record of not abusing this power. Why would we trust your company to act responsibly with this function? Because if Justin Sun is in any way involved with the entity, or even has a sizeable ownership percentage in the entity, that controls this function… Well then this conversation is probably a non-starter.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Hello Ed, TrueUSD used to have a freeze function and that function was removed on request by MakerDAO when we first launched TrueUSD with them. TrueUSD is a centralized stablecoin that is set up differently than other stablecoins where we use third-party custodians (trust companies and banks) that hold the TrueUSD holder funds in escrow accounts that can not be accessed by the TrueUSD team. All out balances are attested by an independent auditor on an ongoing basis, no other stablecoin provides that functionality. You can follow this link: TrustExplorer by Armanino: Real-Time Attest for TrueCurrency for further information and the current audit reports. We basically have linked Armanino directly to the bank accounts and they are pulling the amounts and verifying them against the TrueUSD amounts in circulation on all chains in real-time. TrueUSD has also established a bank-level compliance program that conservatively vets all users before they can interact with the stablecoin directly, the program is audited on an ongoing basis. TrueUSD has been on the forefront of stablecoin development and has strived to be the most transparent and trusted stablecoin out there. We go further than any other stablecoin issuer putting the power to mint and redeem in the hand of the user, establishing failsafes, are regulated via FinCen as a Money Service Business, and are using escrow accounts that will still operate was the centralised entity of TrueCoin LLC no longer be operating. In regards to your concerns about Justin Sun there is no relation between TrueUSD and him other than he is an advisor to allow TrueUSD to a.) increase adoption within the TRON network and b.) provide his expertise in marketing efforts within Asia. He is not part of the running of TrueUSD nor does he own any part of TrueUSD or the entities that own and operate TrueUSD. I hope this helps address your concerns, let me know if I can answer any other question!
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
